If you want a working justice system you don't start by punishing the prosecutors. The idea is idiotic to even bring up in my opinion.

 
 There are cases when the prosecutor has gone overboard and has cost innocent men and women suffering. Also, the state is the one that put the person behind bars wrongly in the first place. That person deserves to be compensated, no question about that. My opinion is, if no individual can be held accountable, then the state must compensate the wrongly convicted, since they put him/her behind bars in the first place. If a person was convicted wrongly, then there must have been an error somewhere. There is no "perfect framing" where there were no discrepancies in the investigation or prosecution.
 
 
 
 
If the price of compensating wrongfully convicted felons is for DAs to stop seeking justice for those that actually did it then the system is broken in a more dangerous manner.

 
 What evidence do you have that this will happen? It didn't with doctors, what makes you think it will happen with prosecutors? I say we only blame the prosecutors if they were responsible for the wrongful conviction. If they are not, then it is the state's duty to compensate.
